title: Keystone XL pipeline clears hurdle in Senate, opening way for final vote â as it happened | US news | The Guardian
summary: republicans get to 60 votes to advance keystone bill .
paul ryan rules out 2016 presidential run .
video : white house admits mistake on paris rally .
democrats attack gop on homeland security funding .
earnest : 'we should have sent someone higher ' to paris .

text: we 're going to wrap up our live blog coverage for the day .
here 's a summary of where things stand : senate republicans and a handful of democrats successfully advanced legislation to build the keystone xl pipeline by a 63-32 vote in favor of cloture .
a final vote on the keystone bill was announced for friday .
in other political news , paul ryan , the 2012 republican vice presidential nominee , announced he would not run for president in 2016 .
the move was seen as at least partially motivated by signals that ryan 's 2012 running mate , mitt romney , is preparing a 2016 run .
ryan was not the only politician to announce non-plans on monday .
missouri senator claire mccaskill said she would not run for governor and california lieutenant governor gavin newsom said he would not run for senator .
the white house admitted it screwed up by not sending a higher-ranking official to the huge anti-terror rally in paris sunday .
here 's video of the press secretary 's frank admission .
final vote is 63-32 in favor , with five not bothering .
americans love saying it 's a free country .
and who 's to stop them .
it 's a philip rucker ( @ philiprucker ) now 's the fun time when each sen gives take on mitt '16 rt @ twitterid : mccain to @ twitterid on romney potential run : `` it 's a free country ''

documents.title: republicans get to 60 votes to advance keystone bill
text: now the senate will begin the messy maybe it wo n't be messy this time ?
process to amend the legislation before bringing it to the floor for final passage or not which will happen friday , mcconnell said .
any bets on how this vote is going to come down ?
63 in favor ?
anybody willing to go higher than that ?
the members are responding to the call to vote .
an increasing deal of milling now in front of the rostrum .
crickets in the senate as the first round of the roll-call vote proceeds .
meanwhile cbs news ' mark knoller is counting veto threats from the obama administration , which has used the veto only twice and not since 2010 .
back when harry reid was majority leader .
mark knoller ( @ markknoller ) make that 5 veto threats .
latest against a house bill that wh says would block new govt regulations .
there is a motion to close debate on the floor on s.1 , a bill to approve the keystone xl pipeline .
it 's a roll call vote .
empty chamber at the moment .
the cloture vote on the keystone legislation is expected shortly , at 5.30pm et .

the yeses will include one of the independents who caucuses with the democratic minority , nbc news reports : frank thorp v ( @ frankthorpnbc ) sen king ( i-me ) says he does not support bill to approve keystone , but will vote yes on procedural measure to move to debate
congress is like any other office .
bad lighting .
languor marked by bursts of activity .
runs on treats .
chad pergram ( @ chadpergram ) rep steve stivers ( r-osu ) handing out chocolate & peanut butter `` buckeyes '' at rules cmte mtg .
# osuvsore cspan ( @ cspan ) .
@ rulesreps meets on homeland security spending live on c-span3
in this jan. 7 , 2015 file photo , house ways and means committee chairman paul ryan , r-wis. is seen on capitol hill in washington .
scott applewhite/ap david m. drucker ( @ davidmdrucker ) prez candidates do n't grow beards .
rt @ twitterid : paul ryan .
beard.just saying .
fivethirtyeight 's harry enten on the ryan news : harry enten ( @ forecasterenten ) the dots here are n't hard to connect .
why is ryan announcing now ?
he could have held out # romney
well put .
daveweigel ( @ daveweigel ) obama and paris , mccaskill and # mogov , ryan and wh .
big day for politicians not doing things .
here 's a choice ryan quote from september of last year : i would n't if he were .
i would support mitt .
if he were to run , i would not , ryan said .
but i do n't even know if i 'm going to either myself .
that 's something i 'm going to decide in 2015 .

documents.title: paul ryan rules out 2016 presidential run
text: the 2012 republican vice presidential nominee has ruled out a run at the white house in an interview with nbc news : i have decided that i am not going to run for president in 2016 , ryan said in a phone interview , noting that he is at peace with the decision he made weeks ago to forgo a bid for the white house .

it is amazing the amount of encouragement i have gotten from people - from friends and supporters - but i feel like i am in a position to make a big difference where i am and i want to do that , he said .
read the full piece here .
more to come .
ryan , his party 's leader in congress on budget reform , would 've been on anyone 's short list of serious contenders .
sabrina siddiqui ( @ sabrinasiddiqui ) paul ryan will not run for president in 2016

documents.title: video : white house admits mistake on paris rally
text: here 's video from press secretary josh earnest 's daily briefing this afternoon in which he says the white house admits it should have sent an official with a higher profile to the paris rally sunday .
at the end he addresses the hacking of social media accounts belonging to us central command by infiltrators claiming ties to the militant group isis .
for those just joining , here is some further background on the keystone debate now playing out on capitol hill .
it appears a resolution of some kind is nigh to a fight that has raged since george w bush 's state department approved the pipeline in march 2008 .
the new republican majority in congress has made the $ 8bn project , which would transport crude from the tar sands of alberta to the texas gulf coast , a top priority .
legislation passed the house last week .
at the core of the keystone issue is a battle between environmentalists and energy interests which has accrued symbolic weight in the country 's political wars .

the guardian 's us environment correspondent , suzanne goldenberg , has described four myths attached to the proposed pipeline , including that it would create a substantial number of long-term jobs or that it would not contribute to pollution .
the state department in its analysis found keystone would create about 42,000 direct and indirect temporary construction jobs , and about 50 permanent jobs once construction is finished .
read more here .
the price of oil fell off a cliff again on monday morning , potentially raising questions about the urgency of keystone ( you can revisit our live coverage of oil 's impressive collapse here ) .
poland spring water at staples now costs more than twice as much as brent crude .
and it does n't irk ranchers .
the senate is not , as the keystone bill moves toward a shoe-in cloture vote this afternoon in advance of a projected final vote friday , the scene of great civic drama .
there was a quorum call .
then brian schatz , the senior senator from hawaii ( since 2012 ) , spoke about keystone .
the 114th congress , off and running .

it 's said the 54 republicans have at least nine democratic allies , led by energy committee member joe manchin of west virginia , in support of the keystone legislation , moving them comfortably over the 60-vote cloture threshold ( but leaving them short of a veto-proof majority of 67 ) .

the national journal flags a question from a reporter at the white house who pointed out that vice president joe biden apparently had the weekend free and could presumably have attended the paris rally sunday .
national journal ( @ nationaljournal ) biden was allegedly `` sitting at home all weekend and presumably could have gone '' to paris march
cspan has published a clip of the disturbance from earlier .
the stills make it look like there was an earthquake .
cspan ( @ cspan ) clip : a disturbance in senate occurs while @ twitterid speaks .
while susan collins , republican of maine , talks about pensions , we 're going to backfill on some of the news we mentioned in the introduction to this blog .
two democrats declined to mount new political campaigns today claire mccaskill , the senior senator from missouri , said she would not run for governor in 2016 , as had been widely speculated .
elise foley ( @ elisefoley ) news : people not running for things .
and gavin newsom , lietenant governor of california , said he would not seek a senate seat being vacated by barbara boxer in 2016 , probably because he wants to run for governor instead .
read more about newsom here .
here 's his statement .
chris cillizza ( @ thefix ) rt @ twitterid : @ twitterid newsom has been pretty clear that 2018 gov race is his next preferred step for a while .
we also mentioned that monica lewinsky has declined to voice her support for hillary clinton for president , should clinton run .
here 's part of a report on that from the hill which , as usual ( ?
) , is chasing reporting by tmz : but when a photographer asked as she was escorted to a waiting care whether she would vote hillary in 2016 , lewinsky 's lips remained sealed .
thanks , she was heard telling a minder before being whisked away .
update on the protest that interrupted senate proceedings earlier this hour .
politico reports they were chanting , torture is a crime !
and close guantanamo now !
and they are being sent home each with a pair of commemorative federal government handcuffs .
manu raju ( @ mkraju ) `` torture is a crime ! ''
protesters chanting on the third floor of the senate .
`` close guantanamo now ! ''
they are being cuffed .
if you want to re-watch the paris rally , it 's re-playing now on cspan .
here 's a of no americans of note attending .
( that 's not jane hartley , us ambassador to france , extreme left ? )
howard mortman ( @ howardmortman ) missed sunday 's paris unity march ?
it 's now replaying on c-span update : here 's what hartley looks like : devindwyer ( @ devindwyer ) .
@ usambfrance jane hartley , frmr obama bundler , was admin 's rep at # paris march .
wh says she was n't hi-profile enuf >
republicans want to talk about keystone today .
democrats want to talk about immigration today .
action on the floor !
a group of protesters interrupts durbin with a largely inaudible ( on cspan ) chant about us torture .
the sergeant at arms flies into action to clear the protesters from the gallery .
by the sound of their chants there are at least half a dozen .
the cameras do n't pan to them .
they 're fading out .
durbin is waiting .
and it 's over .
one more outburst , and you will be arrested , the sergeant-at-arms warns .
durbin resumes talking about deferred action on deportation of some undocumented immigrants .

documents.title: democrats attack gop on homeland security funding
text: minority whip dick durbin lashes into republicans for insisting that the department of homeland security only be funded through the end of feburary .
he 's echoing what earnest said earlier .
the gop move is designed to create an opportunity to defund obama 's immigration policies .
which actually would not be possible , according to republicans on the house appropriations committee .
congressional republicans apparently intend to try , anyway .
read more here .

documents.title: mcconnell takes up keystone bill
text: mcconnell calls for debate on s.1 , a bill to approve the keystone xl pipeline .
a cloture vote a motion to move the legislation on to an amendments process is scheduled for 5.30 pm et monday .
mcconnell 's speaking about keystone .
he says the nebraska supreme court has eliminated the last conceivable pretext to put off a vote on the bill .
we 're stepping away from the white house daily briefing for a moment .
the senate chaplain is reading an invocation as the chamber opens for daily business .
there are some new faces in the crowd : joni ernst ( @ joniernst ) today i begin my 1st full week as iowa 's us senator .
i look fwd to serving the people of iowa let 's get to work !
how long will obama 's failure to travel to paris fester in the political discourse ?
southpaw ( @ nycsouthpaw ) the same people who brought you freedom fries and wine boycotts will now call for hearings on insufficient presidential travel to paris .
ed henry of fox points out that obama attended nelson mandela 's funeral ceremony , also a big outdoor event with security risks .

henry does n't bring up the revelation after the funeral that a security breach had occurred when a fake sign language interpreter , a self-described schizophrenic with a violent past , was allowed to stand within feet of and interpret obama during the president 's remarks .
so what did obama do on sunday ?
i have not spoken with the president about what he did yesterday .
earnest is pressed on why obama did n't travel to paris .
he says the rally was last-minute , with 36 hours notice .
then earnest says the security arrangements needed to send the president might have disrupted the rally , outdoors with a large number of people .
we are mindful we want to try to mitigate the impact that the security precautions would have on the participants of this public event .
he says obama 's presence would have significantly impacted the experience of participants of the events .
the huffington post notes that the kind of admission of error we just heard has not been an everyday occurrence over the course of the obama years .
sam stein ( @ samsteinhp ) is this the first time the white house has bowed to the optics ?
next , from a member of the french press : how did president obama follow the sunday demonstration in paris ?
earnest says he does n't know how much obama watched on tv , but he made note of the impressive display .
earnest is asked whether the criticism of the white house decision on the paris rally is fair .
it is certainly a free country , he says .
that 's refreshing .
earnest continues to take questions about the tick-tock of the white house decision not to send any higher profile figure to the paris rally .
he says he ca n't unpack the decision .
what i 'm saying is that we here at the white house agree that someone with a higher profile should have been included .
earnest wo n't comment on the nature of a french invitation or not to attend .
there should not be and there is not any doubt in the minds of the people of france and certainly not among our enemies about how committed the united states is to france , earnest says .

documents.title: earnest : 'we should have sent someone higher ' to paris
text: earnest is asked why the white house did not send a higher-level official to represent the united states at a huge peace rally in paris on sunday joined by leaders from around the world .
the us ambassador to france attended the rally .
i think it 's fair to say that we should have sent someone with a higher profile to be there , earnest says .
white house press secretary josh earnest has just taken the lectern in the brady briefing room .

he begins by criticizing republicans for moving to modify legislation to fund the department of homeland security as it applies to the president 's policy of deferring action on deportations of some undocumented immigrants .
cspan ( @ cspan ) white house press briefing with @ twitterid josh earnest live on c-span
hello , and welcome to our live-blog coverage as republicans make a play to call president barack obama on his veto threat or was it a bluff ?
over the keystone xl pipeline .
that 's not the only show going in politics on this january monday , but it promises to be a main event .
newly minted senate majority leader mitch mcconnell plans to convene his chamber at 2pm et for the keystone debate .

meanwhile , there are developing politics stories in missouri and california , where a couple of high-profile democrats have announced , separately , that they will not be launching new election campaigns .

and monica lewinsky , the former paramour of former president bill clinton , has declined to say whether she would vote for his wife , hillary clinton , should the latter decide to make a run for the white house in 2016 .
we enjoin you to join us for the day in politics and , as always , let us know in the comments what stories you 're following .

Last conceivable pretext' for delay is gone, McConnell says.
